Package shared

Class ServerImpl

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
shared.ServerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote, Iserver
public class ServerImpl
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements Iserver
Gives remote actions to the clients
Version:
1.0
Author:
vincent acila

    • isAGoodMove

      public int isAGoodMove​(int source, int destination, java.lang.String GMId, iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Function which calls isAGoodMove from GameManager
      Specified by:
      isAGoodMove in interface Iserver
      Parameters:
      source - the source cell of the move
      destination - the destination cell of the move
      GMId - the string identifying the GameManager
      client - the client sending the request
      Returns:
      An information code. -1 : It doesn't belong to the player to play. 0 : The move is valid 1 : The move is unvalid
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
      java.lang.NullPointerException - raised if the GameManager object doesn't exist. Can occurred if a player left the game.

    • playMove

      public int playMove​(int source, int destination, java.lang.String GMId, iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Function which calls playMove from GameManager
      Specified by:
      playMove in interface Iserver
      Parameters:
      source - the source cell of the move
      destination - the destination cell of the move
      GMId - the string identifying the GameManager
      client - the client sending the request
      Returns:
      An information code. -1 : It doesn't belong to the player to play. x : The code returned by GameManager.playMove()
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
      java.lang.NullPointerException - raised if the GameManager object doesn't exist. Can occurred if a player left the game.

    • isGameOver

      public int isGameOver​(java.lang.String GMId, iClient client) throws java.rmi.RemoteException, java.lang.NullPointerException
      Function which calls isGameOver from GameManager
      Specified by:
      isGameOver in interface Iserver
      Parameters:
      GMId - the string identifying the GameManager
      client - the client sending the request
      Returns:
      An information code. -1 : the game is still running 0 : the client who sent the request won 1 : the client who sent the request loose
      Throws:
      java.rmi.RemoteException - raised during connection issue by RMI
      java.lang.NullPointerException - raised if the GameManager object doesn't exist. Can occurred if a player left the game.
